alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 3:50AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory this morning, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as zero. * WHERE...Jefferson and St. Clair Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST early this morning. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 8 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages.
